item.title: Overgrown trees and bushes, 9th August

item.title: Broken glass in basketball area of park, 9th August
item.description:
Broken glass on the black surface of the basketball court in the park (there may also be some on the green surface and perhaps in the grass now). Also an abandoned B&M shopping trolley in the same park. However the broken glass shards are more of concern and a danger to children.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 18 Newdawn Place, Cheltenham

item.title: Overhanging tree near bus stop on Prestbury Road, 8th August
item.description:
This lime tree has grown far too large for the narrow pavement on which it's situated, and now overhangs our front garden by more than 2.5 metres. Some years ago we had to lay gravel in the front garden because the effect of the tree meant that we couldn't grow anything successfully. Now we spend a substantial amount of time every year clearing bracts, leaves, fallen branches and other debris from our front garden. Basically, this tree has ruined the front half of our front garden. We are therefore asking for it to be substantially cut back or removed altogether. We would be happy for it to be replaced with a smaller specimen that did not intrude on our property.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 69 Prestbury Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
